title: A PostgreSQL database driver for WebAssembly · Issue #1432 · WasmEdge/WasmEdge

last_post.content:
It's cool that Postgres runs in the browser thanks to WASM. But I don't need that. What I do need is a Postgres /driver/ that runs in the browser, as envisioned here: https://github.com/WasmEdge/WasmEdge/issues/1432

That would enable me to build Steampipe-backed apps -- like the Mastodon dashboard I'm developing -- using vanilla JS. I would love to try that.

If/when you see a WASM Postgres driver that's real, please let me know!

#postgresql #postgres #wasm #steampipe

last_post.content:
Annoying FUD article from #California saying that #EV mandates will triple #electricity consumption by 2035.

This is, of course, nonsense. Response here.

TL/DR: Switching over every single vehicle at once would only increase electricity demand by about 1/3rd, and switching over sales doesn't suddenly transform the whole fleet.

title: Welcome to the official, historical archive of Dolly Parton

last_post.content:
Entertainer, childhood literacy advocate, and scientific philanthropist Dolly Parton was born #OTD in 1946.

Mostly known for singing and songwriting, Dolly's Imagination Library program has distributed over 100 million free books to kids around the world.
https://dollyparton.com/imagination-library

Normally I do #OTD posts for scientists and mathematicians, or important discoveries. But Dolly Parton has done as much as any living person to promote childhood literacy so I am proud to include her on the list.

title: How do you deal with Abandonware?

last_post.content:
Re the last boost.

We do NOT have a framework ready to deal with cybernetic limbs and things like the manufacturer going broke or just deciding it doesn't want to support them anymore.

Here's a perfect example. People get a cybernetic eye system installed only for the company that manufactured the system to basically abandon them and end support.

Before you go waxing lyrical about a cybernetic future, let's make sure that we don't end up with a whole bunch of dead tech hanging off people.

https://www.angrybeanie.com/news/how-do-you-deal-with-abandonware

Asahi GPU driver: is a standard Mesa driver with kmsro, just like basically everything other than Intel/AMD/Nvidia.

Chromium: adds a whitelist policy specifically for it 🤦‍♂️​

This is not the first time Chromium "fixes" a bug for only the narrowest possible domain, we've run into similar stuff with the 16K story.

Folks, if your software has trouble running on Asahi, chances are it's equally broken on lots of other platforms you don't know about. Unless you're a distro dealing with firmware blobs and bootloaders, there is approximately nothing unique about Apple Silicon/Asahi platforms that you need to care about. If you find yourself adding an if(asahi) to your code, you are probably doing it wrong. Please fix your underlying incorrect assumptions, not just add a hack for our platform specifically.

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4119913

There's three troubles (at least) I see with ChatGPT:
* The issue with seemingly exploiting people doing the hard work of filtering out inappropriate content.
* The issue with using content they may not have permission to use (and then passing the buck to the user in order to verify if they have permission to use the outputs, while providing no help for that process) https://write.as/o1u8x2uycky1m
* Despite having a large amount of information, the output is not always correct - and I get that they say that on the start page, but it needs to be highlighted a lot more as people seem to think it is something it isn't https://blog.edross.co.uk/post/706555817427632129/you-must-not-trust-chatgpt

I've enjoyed using it (mostly for fiction, where there is more room for veering away from truth) https://blog.edross.co.uk/archive/tagged/chatgpt
But I have been wondering, especially after the Kenya revelations, if it is worth it.

title: Report: Paying farmers to sequester CO2 far cheaper than carbon capture tech

Credit: iStock
Image:

python -m pip install --upgrade pandas==1.5.3

Or from conda-forge

mamba install -c conda-forge pandas==1.5.3
